Description: Roundel fragment from the lower part of the clavus; tapestry is applied and sewn on plain weave linen; the roundel has three concentric circles, the central part is decorated with a quadruped (lion?) running on a red background and surrounded by two red and yellow floral motifs; the central medallion is surrounded by a freize of stylized vegetal and floral motifs (red and pink heart-shaped flowers on yellow background); final part of the tapestry is a freize of multi-coloured geometric motifs on a dark blue background; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/14), weft-undyed linen (S/16); all edges cut or ragged, a run-and-fell seam c.2 cm, sewing threads in undyed linen threads (S spun Z ply), oversewing and running stitches; tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/10), weft-undyed linen (S), pink, red, yellow, blue and dark blue (S/green is 76); edges mostly hemmed and sewn with oversewing in linen (S spun Z ply), at the top part edge is ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
